Reviews.Title: Amazing machine
Reviews.Author: Ric Caselli
Reviews.Content: I had this phone for over a year. It took some time for the software to catch up, but as it is now I would not want to do without it.It's perfect as:Phone - I can make calls on cellular, on wi-fi over SIP or on skypeBrowser - firefox synced with my 2 work computersemail -  business accounts with IMAP so all syncedContact manager - synced with my LDAP serverPodcast managerMP3 player - perfectwi-fi survey tool - kismet, nmap, wifiEyeCamera is adequate.GPS app is more than adequate.Pretty robust in my experience. If I had to do without it I wouldn't know what to replace it with.

Reviews.Title: Excellent all in one device.
Reviews.Author: Roland
Reviews.Content: This is the best mobile phone I've ever owned.PROSThe web browser is the best of any mobile phone on the market today.  It has flash support right out of the box and webpages show up the way they are supposed to be viewed as if from a computer and not the handicapped mobile version of websites that appear for other phone web browsers.  What other phone allows you to play farmville from your phone browser without downloading something extra?  There is no need to download a facebook app or a twitter app when you can have the whole website.The phone is very fast and allows for true multitasking.  I'm able to play Angry Birds, while listening to my music loaded on the phone, while downloading updates in the background, all the while connected to my big screen TV through the included A/V cables.  I can do all of those things without a stutter and have another dozen windows and programs open at the same time.  The N900 plays GBA and SNES roms smoothly and makes good use of the keyboard.The desktop widgets are a nice touch to make the home screen interesting and extremely customizable.The 5 MP camera takes some of the best cellphone pictures I have ever seen and makes it very convenient to load onto the Internet.The second camera on the front of the phone allows for pretty decent video calls through included Skype support or the Fring program.Battery life lasts about a day.  I comfortably get through the day with 20% of my battery life left after checking email, playing a game or two, listening to a few songs, checking my favorite websites, and talking to a few friends.Mobile hotspot.  This phone can be a mobile hotspot without paying your carrier anything extra.NEGATIVES3G support only for T-Mobile and not AT&T.;  I've used it with AT&T; for months but had to settle for EDGE (2G) speed.  Wifi support makes that less of a problem at home but inconvenient out and about.The GPS is lacking because compared to all of the other Nokia phones with voice guided GPS, this one does not have voice guidance.  So coming from an older Nokia device to this, it is a disappointment to not have voice guidance.

Reviews.Title: One of the best devices ever made
Reviews.Author: G. Gonzalez
Reviews.Content: Nokia was years ahead of the rest with this device and anybody who uses Debian would love it. It may not have many of the modern features and development is slower since this device has been discontinued but you will never find another device like it unless the upcoming Ubuntu phones gain traction. This phone takes a bit of know-how to tweak to perfection and if you have the ability then it is very much worth it.Be warned though: all current development is community driven and Nokia has discontinued the device.

Reviews.Title: it deserves 10 star rating
Reviews.Author: Giorgi Rekhviashvili "Giorgi Rekhviashvili"
Reviews.Content: i have never been so satisfied with any nokia phones and i had several before i bought this one. 4 years i have it and i am still using it. it has great camera that shoots nice photos, touch screen is flawless, i don't even calibrate it. it is durable (dropped it several times no scratch).i have seen people install windows xp on this device somehow, not mentioning meego. but this matters if you like to tease your phone a bit.for past year there has been no software update though.still this piece of machinery is great. don't forget to buy screen protectors.

Reviews.Title: VOIP Revolution has started
Reviews.Author: Agron
Reviews.Content: If you buy this phone you only need data plan. Voice and SMS are transmitted as data also using VOIP with software like Skype and SIP clients.There two technologies, Skype and SIP are integrated as plugins. This means that when you want to make a free call you don't need to first launch as special app, but you choose the contact from you main (the only) contact list and then choose call type such as 1. Voice, 2. Skype, 3.Google Talk, 4. SIP (any sip/voip provider including Vonage), 5.Google Voice, etc.I have had this phone for year and a half on T-Mobile network. 4G is perfect except in Manhattan. I have a 5GB per month plan and I pay 39.99 with taxes and everything included. This deal was only available for a month during xmass of 2010.

Reviews.Title: Best Phone Available
Reviews.Author: Kristofer Occhipinti
Reviews.Content: I've owned my N900 for about a year and a half now.  I'll be holding on to it for a while because no one has made a phone nearly as good.  If you want the power of a Linux Desktop in your pocket this is the device for you.  You can running pretty much any program that you can on a Linux Desktop.  You have not only the bunch of programs available in Maemo repositories, but you also have all the Debian repositories available.I see some reviews talking about bad battery life.  I have great battery life.  It last a day and a half with a good about of usage.  I did have a battery issue a one point, but that was because I changed out the default kernel for one with a few more feature.  The battery would only last 4 or 5 hours then, but once I reloaded the stock kernel the battery life went back up to over a full day.I love having a physical keyboard. And the Camera is pretty good.  If you are looking for the fastest and the newest hardware, this is obviously not the phone for you.  It was pretty good when it came out, but that was a while ago.  But, if power and freedom in software is what you want this is the only phone I would recommend.  It can do many many things other phones can't, just because the other phones have limitations put on them by the manufacturers. This phone has no software limitations.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Phone
Reviews.Author: Jitendra
Reviews.Content: Its amazing phone or mini pc. Internet is superb, you will not feel surfing on phone. Looks are good, quite bulky but its ok.

Reviews.Title: Nokia N900 purchase
Reviews.Author: uswic54321
Reviews.Content: received my N900 and accessories on time and shipped items were brand new as promised. All were in good shape except N900 battery charger.it worked only once and failed afterwards , had to replace that.

Reviews.Title: Good buy
Reviews.Author: Rochelle L.
Reviews.Content: Pros: works without a SIM card and really fast without service. I don't think you need a service with a phone like this! It's just like having a computer. I'm not really picky as long as I can use it. It came on time! My other phone wasn't functioning properly so the time I received it saved me.Cons: It's a used phone for $99. I didn't expect it to be functioning like new. It came with extra batteries like seller said but only because it has trouble sustaining battery life and USB port came loose and fell out of phone when I pulled out USB cord on the day I got it. I couldn't really charge it through cord anyway because it wasn't detecting power through the cord. I have to change to a new charged battery three to four times in a day for the past two days I've had it.There's also left over information from previous owner in the phone. I'm still trying to find a way to get rid of ALL of it. There's no Outbox or anything, at least, none that I know of yet.Overall, I won't be getting rid of it anytime soon.

Reviews.Title: Serious Issues
Reviews.Author: Mohamed A Kamara
Reviews.Content: When I purchased this phone it won't turn on.Never purchase items that are shipped from outside the US.It's a headache dealing with the Vendor. I really wanted this phone, but I might have to find another Vendor in the US,and not in Hong Kong where it was shipped from.

Reviews.Title: What No MMS phone to phone
Reviews.Author: js
Reviews.Content: Great phone for Voice and Data but NO MMS... Whats that about?  Can't send a picture phn to phn.. ?? don't like that. You have to use internet email to send a picture. Sometimes ya just want to send a picture. SMS is great.. Mesg alert Alarm etc.. great phone but I'm going to have to change due to the Picture messageing.. :(

Reviews.Title: Not intended to be used in USA (as per NOKIA)
Reviews.Author: Shyam
Reviews.Content: Stopped workign after a month. touch screen sopped working, no button works... Seller said after 30days they don't have return policy.I contacted Nokia and they said this phone is not intended to be used or marketed in USA.

Reviews.Title: Bad luck / poor quality + dishonest seller
Reviews.Author: John Doe
Reviews.Content: Surprisingly enough (as we have another N900 that worked OK for years) this one started developing issues with the touch screen about a week after we got it. In a month it got completely non-usable, to the point one can not even start it (by sliding finger on touch screen). Working with the vendor trying to get a replacement and give it another try. In light of the current experience, I can not recommend these phones to anybody, Also, Nokia stopped developing their Maemo line and actually got purchased by Microsoft. I do not expect much support coming from there... :-( F for Fail. The vendors proved to be dishonest. I returned the phone via UPS (another $18 I have to spend on that). Seller received the phone a week ago and since their only reaction was to claim they need "1-2 business days to review the item". They did not replaced or refunded the purchase. I had to call Amazon customer service that promised I wil lbe refunded in maximum two weeks. Let's see...

Reviews.Title: if only i could give no stars....
Reviews.Author: Mujaheed Abdul-majied
Reviews.Content: Seller was the worst part of the experience. The phone and OS are way behind even cheap comparables. The battery failed after 2 uses.....i could go on and on. Suffice to say look somewhere else for a good phone.

Reviews.Author: Selorme K
Reviews.Content: The item arrived on time that's a plus but I did not get an AV cable, neither the micro fiber cloth and it took me about 5 hours to charge my battery with the charger provided also the USB is terrible I have to adjust it a couple of times before it connects to a computer. It's a little awful to know what a standard nokia n900 comes with, and after purchase not get everything.

Reviews.Title: not working anymore
Reviews.Author: mariajoselucena
Reviews.Content: Nokia disappoint me. This phone was just what I want, until it doesnt work anymore. Just dead.So Nokia is dead to me, i am buying Samsung

Reviews.Title: No to Nokia N900
Reviews.Author: Po
Reviews.Content: I had the Nokia 6030 for approximately 6 years and it was a good phone.  I used it primarily for making calls.  I wanted to upgrade due to the texting, picture, and MMS craze.  I purchased the Nokia N900 through Amazon and it was a problem from the first day.  Once I received it I noticed it did not have picture sending (MMS) capability.  When I called Nokia to enquire, they told me that it doesn't have that feature.  I had very bad battery life and the phone was replaced by Amazon within the first 30 days, with the same result.  I decided to keep it and live with the poor battery life.  Then the phone started doing things like the calendar would not remind me if I set it for multiple day reminders.  It started turning itself off and turning back on again and the turning control wouldn't work.  I had to scroll through all my contacts to make a call.  I contacted Nokia to get the phone repaired to no avail.  I sent this phone in four times and they sent a replacement twice with the same results.  I would not recommend this phone to anyone.  I will not buy another Nokia product EVER; this is based on the POOR customer service I received from them. Just my two cent.

Reviews.Title: Disappointing.
Reviews.Author: purchase
Reviews.Content: After reading all the great reviews, i decided to invest my $400+ on this phone. I received it yesterday January 27th from USPS and just after an hour, it indicated that the battery was low. I put it on charge and went out for 6 hours. I came back and the phone was still signalling that the battery is low. I decided to switch it off so that the charging can be effective and after an hour, i tried switching it on and it won't come on. Now i'm stuck with a new phone that cannot be switched on. Just for me to be sure i was not scammed, i checked the product information and the phone is made in Finland, the charger is made in China and the USB cord is made in Thailand. Isn't that fishy? I will take it to a nokia customer center for an evaluation. I hope they give me some good news else i will spread the bad news like a wild fire.I had high hopes for this phone because i have always been a loyal customer of nokia phones but now i'm wondering as to whether i was scammed or that the phone isn't good after all. I can't say anything good or bad about the phone until i get some information from nokia. I'm happy for those who have had a good experience. I can't say the same thing. Sorry...............

Reviews.Title: There's bad, really bad and then there is Nokia
Reviews.Author: Carol-Ann Dearnaley
Reviews.Content: What better gift for someone who travels often to Europe than an unlocked Nokia N-900?  Try anything but an N-900.  Two phones later - the second one dying within 24 hours of being returned from Nokia, I threw in the towel and cried, "basta!" Dealing with the company was one of the most frustrating experiences I've had.  Their idea of customer service is to offer, no insist, on a 10 business day turn around time.  Even with "expedited service" it was 10 business days.  Never again for Nokia phones.  It's just not worth it.  Blackberry Torch anyone?

Reviews.Title: Don't buy this!!!
Reviews.Author: exnokiafan
Reviews.Content: This device may look great, and have a lot of features, however, battery life is terrible, I have to charge it twice a day, and software development fot this phone is very poor... does not have msn live messenger support.. and now, flash player is outdated, and they are not planning on doing an update for this phone, which means that you can not watch facebook youtube videos... and other webpages... so if you get this phone, you will get stuck with a machine that nokia left to rott... I bought it, and I am really dissapointed... you should better get an N97.... I wish I had...

ProductInfo.Features:
Brand new , unpacked, Unopen box
Color: Black
ProductInfo.Name: Nokia N900 Unlocked Cell Phone/Mobile Computer with 3.5 Inch Touchscreen
